title: EU research initiatives in multimodal interaction
segmentation: Do you hear me?
OK, thank you very much for inviting me to this workshop, which I think is a very good example of what can be done if you join forces between several projects doing similar stuff.

Now, this is perhaps the natural thing here, since there is a certain overlap of the consortium, but I think nevertheless it's a very good example which which deserves to be followed by others as well, and I hope it's the 1st in serious similar events.
I wanted to give you a brief overview, let's say or what's what has been going on in the Commission in terms of research initiatives.
Well, we could call it funding opportunities for research in the area of multimodal interaction, broadly speaking.
Um?

And also give a few hints of what's to come because we are now entering the face of the second half of the 6th Framework Programme at the same time as we are starting planning for the next framework program.
I'm working in the Directorate involved with or are responsible for knowledge technologies, interfaces, cognition and similar things.
And we are based in Luxembourg and I'm project Officer actually over these projects, even projects which are discussed at this workshop.
We have course I will come to that later in the presentation.
A number of colleagues in Brussels doing.
Also, you know supporting research work which is interesting for you.
